abstract.text: The way a view changes over time to create a smooth visual transition from
one state to another.

inlineContent.text: An
provides a visual transition of a view when a state value
changes from one value to another. The characteristics of this transition
vary according to the animation type. For instance, a
animation
provides a mechanical feel to the animation because its speed is consistent
from start to finish. In contrast, an animation that uses easing, like
, offers a more natural feel by varying the acceleration
of the animation.
To apply an animation to a view, add the
modifier, and specify both an animation type and the value to animate. For
instance, the
view in the following code performs an
animation each time the state variable
changes:
When the value of
changes, the modifier
resizes
according to the
new value. OpenSwiftUI can animate the transition between sizes because
conforms to the
protocol. Shapes in OpenSwiftUI conform to
the
protocol, which describes how to animate a property of a
view.
In addition to adding an animation to a view, you can also configure the
animation by applying animation modifiers to the animation type. For
example, you can:
Delay the start of the animation by using the
modifier.
Repeat the animation by using the
or
modifiers.
Change the speed of the animation by using the
modifier.
For example, the
view in the following code repeats
the
animation three times by using the
modifier:
A view can also perform an animation when a binding value changes. To
specify the animation type on a binding, call its
method. For example, the view in the following code performs a
animation, moving the box truck between the leading and trailing
edges of the view. The truck moves each time a person clicks the
control, which changes the value of the
binding.

A spring animation with a predefined duration and small amount of

or
animations on the same property, each

An animation with a specified duration that starts slowly and then
increases speed towards the end of the movement.
An interpolating spring animation that uses a damped spring
model to produce values in the range [0, 1] that are then used
to interpolate within the [from, to] range of the animated
property. Preserves velocity across overlapping animations by
adding the effects of each animation.
